DOC.brief_summary: The investigators assume that an intervention program that includes home visits and trainings of diabetes' nurse and dietitian will lead to an improvement of the patients' metabolic balance, a decrease in complications' rate, a reduction of hospitalizations and an economic streamlining.
DOC.brief_title: Constructed Intervention by Home and School Diabetes Nurse Visits on Diabetic Control of Children With Type I Diabetes
DOC.detailed_description: The investigators assume that during the study, subjects from the intervention group will reach a better metabolic balance than the control group. In this group the following changes will occur: - A decrease in HbA1C levels. - A decrease in Hypoglycemia events. - A decrease in DKA events. - A decrease in patients' visits in ER and hospitalizations. - An improvement in the knowledge of the patients and their families about the disease.
DOC.criteria: Type 1 DM diagnosis from at least 8 months/ HbA1C levels >8 Signed inform consent. Children who are not in educational settings and are not hebrew or arabic speakers.
